gstat.premade.uno

Class Uno

  • java.lang.Object
    • gstat.premade.uno.Uno

  • public class Uno
extends java.lang.Object
    This project will run a simulation on the game of UNO! This is a card game. The goal is for a player to lose all the cards in their hand. This is accomplished by playing cards of the same color or number as the card in play. There are also special cards that allow the player to play on any card, skip players turn, and reverse turn order.
    Author:
    Camden Voigt

      static void createCards(java.util.ArrayList<UnoCard> d)
      Creates a List to store cards to populate the UNO deck.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method used to call any number of games.
      static void play()
      This method will play one game of UNO and print a log of the actions taken to the console and a file called log.txt.
      static void playSilent()
      This method will play one game of UNO and will not print a log of the actions taken to the console and a file called log.txt.
      static void reshuffle(Deck<UnoCard> playDeck, Deck<UnoCard> discardDeck)
      Repopulates and reshuffles the play deck using the contents of the discard deck.
      static void statistics()
      This method uses the global counters to calculate statistics of all the games.

      • reshuffle

        public static void reshuffle(Deck<UnoCard> playDeck,
                             Deck<UnoCard> discardDeck)
        Repopulates and reshuffles the play deck using the contents of the discard deck.
        Parameters:
        playDeck - Empty deck of cards to be drawn
        discardDeck - Empty deck of cards that have been discarded
